title: Offset Calculation Function
description: This function computes an offset value based on several boolean inputs that determine which offset to apply to the input value X. If the boolean input D is true, the function returns a default offset value; otherwise, it starts with X and adds the appropriate offset based on O1, O2, O3, or O4 flags.
name: OFFSET2

input.name: X
input.description: The primary input value that may receive an offset.

input.name: O1
input.description: Flag indicating whether to add Offset_1.

input.name: O2
input.description: Flag indicating whether to add Offset_2.

input.name: O3
input.description: Flag indicating whether to add Offset_3.

input.name: O4
input.description: Flag indicating whether to add Offset_4.

input.name: D
input.description: Flag that determines if the default value should be returned instead of the adjusted X.

input.name: Offset_1
input.description: Value to be added if O1 is true.

input.name: Offset_2
input.description: Value to be added if O2 is true.

input.name: Offset_3
input.description: Value to be added if O3 is true.

input.name: Offset_4
input.description: Value to be added if O4 is true.

input.name: default
input.description: The default value returned if D is true.

output.name: OFFSET2
output.description: The calculated offset value which is either the adjusted X or the default value.

return_value.description: Returns the final computed offset value.
